alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:57PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern El Paso County through 145 PM MDT... At 1257 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodland Park, or 14 miles northwest of Colorado Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Monument around 105 PM MDT. Air Force Academy and Gleneagle around 110 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Manitou Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
